Package game.modes

Class ModeManager

java.lang.Object
game.modes.ModeManager
public class ModeManager
extends java.lang.Object
ModeManager is a class responsible for managing the core functionalities of the game, including creating a player, selecting a mission, and starting the game in manual or automatic simulation modes. It also includes functionality to display mission and simulation details such as rooms, connections, enemies, items, entry/exit points, and the target.

  • Constructor Details

    • ModeManager

      public ModeManager()
      Default constructor for the ModeManager class. Initializes the instance of the ModeManager by setting its internal mission implementation to null. This class handles the selection of missions, game initialization, and simulation modes.

  • Method Details

    • getRepManager

      public static MissionReportManager getRepManager()
      Retrieves the instance of the MissionReportManager.
      Returns:
      the singleton instance of MissionReportManager.

    • createPlayer

      public Player createPlayer()
      Creates a new player instance by gathering necessary input from the user. This method displays a welcome banner and prompts the user to enter a name and choose a backpack size. It then initializes and returns a Player object with the specified name, default firepower of 100, and the chosen backpack size.
      Returns:
      a newly created Player object initialized with the user's input

    • selectMission

      public void selectMission() throws NotElementComparableException, java.io.IOException, org.json.simple.parser.ParseException
      Handles the mission selection process, allowing the user to choose from predefined missions. The chosen mission is loaded and set as the current mission implementation.

      This method uses a text-based menu to prompt the user to select a mission. Depending on the user's choice, it attempts to load the corresponding mission from a JSON file into the program's network structure.

      If an invalid option is selected, an error message is displayed, and no mission is loaded.

      Throws:
      NotElementComparableException - if the mission data includes elements that are not comparable, making them incompatible with the program's requirements.
      java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the mission file.
      org.json.simple.parser.ParseException - if there is an error parsing the JSON structure of the mission file.

    • startGame

      public void startGame() throws NotElementComparableException, java.io.IOException, org.json.simple.parser.ParseException, ElementNotFoundException, EmptyCollectionException
      Initializes and starts the game by managing the simulation mode selection and handling the game flow accordingly.

      This method performs the following steps: 1. Creates a new player by invoking the `createPlayer` method. 2. Prompts the user to select a mission using the `selectMission` method. 3. Displays a menu to the user for selecting the type of simulation mode (automatic or manual). 4. Based on the user's choice, triggers either the automatic or manual simulation by invoking the respective methods. 5. Displays mission details before starting the simulation. 6. Handles invalid user inputs by displaying an appropriate error message.

      The method can terminate early if the user selects the exit option from the menu.

      Throws:
      NotElementComparableException - if the selected mission contains non-comparable elements.
      java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs during mission selection.
      org.json.simple.parser.ParseException - if the mission configuration file contains parsing errors.
      ElementNotFoundException - if an element required for the simulation is not found.
      EmptyCollectionException - if an operation on a collection is attempted but the collection is empty.
